snippet: The inspector general reported that the tax agency paid for luxury suites and spent thousands of dollars on gifts at a 2010 meeting in Anaheim, Calif.
abstract: Newly released Treasury Department audit shows Internal Revenue Service spent $4.1 million on single conference in Southern California in 2010, paying top dollar for hotel rooms, $27,500 for keynote speaker and tens of thousands of dollars for gifts to attendees; audit shows such expenditures fell sharply after clamp down by Obama White House on travel and conferences as budgets tightened and scandal erupted involving General Services Administration spending.
lead_paragraph: The inspector general reported that the tax agency paid for luxury suites and spent thousands of dollars on gifts at a 2010 meeting in Anaheim, Calif.

headline.seo: I.R.S. Spent $4.1 Million on a Single Conference, Audit Finds
headline.main: I.R.S. Spent $4.1 Million on Conference, Audit Finds
headline.print_headline: I.R.S. Spent $4.1 Million on Conference, Audit Finds

keywords.value: House Committee on Ways and Means
